snippet: Ron Barber, who was at Gabrielle Giffords’s side when she was shot and is recovering from some injuries himself, said he could not say no when she asked him to run.
abstract: Ron Barber, aide to former Rep Gabrielle Giffords, who has said he will run in the special election for the southern Arizona district to replace Giffords, is a reluctant candidate, running only because Giffords asked him to take her place; Barber has spent much of the last year recovering from injuries sustained during the Tucson shooting in January 2011.
lead_paragraph: Ron Barber, who was at Gabrielle Giffords’s side when she was shot and is recovering from some injuries himself, said he could not say no when she asked him to run.

headline.seo: Ron Barber, Reluctant but Loyal, Agreed to Seek Giffords’s Seat
headline.main: Wary but Loyal, Aide Answered Call From Giffords to Run
headline.print_headline: Wary but Loyal, Aide Answered Call From Giffords to Run
